p: Other medical manifestations of the COVID-19 infection include a vasculitis with risk of progressing to gangrene [ [44], [45], [46]]. Some patients have evidence of spleen destruction and diffuse atrophy of lymph nodes, and their associated regional chains [ 45]. Others can harbor evidence of anti-phospholipid, anti-cardiolipin, and anti-Î² 2-glycoprotein antibodies, each of which might signify the presence of a corresponding syndrome, with ramifications that only serve to intensify the demands upon patient management, and those responsible to deliver it [ 47].
